Sentencas: We have developed a general mathematical model to represent the membrane-electrode assembly (MEA) of fuel-cell systems.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: The model is used to analyze the effects of various polarization resistances on cell performance.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: The model accommodates arbitrary gas mixtures on the anode and cathode sides of the MEA.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: Moreover, it accommodates a variety of porous electrode and electrolyte structures.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: Concentration overpotentials are based on a dusty-gas representation of transport through porous electrodes.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: The activation overpotentials are represented using the Butler-Volmer equation.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies

Sentencas: Although the model is general, the emphasis in this paper is on solid-oxide fuel-cell (SOFC) systems for the direct electrochemical oxidation (DECO) of hydrocarbons.
Titulo: A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies
A general mathematical model for analyzing the performance of fuel-cell membrane-electrode assemblies
